title: Making OTF problem
content:
When i generate the open type font at fontlab it shows me this:

[WARNING] feature already defined: kern [C:/Documents and Settings/Fernando/Mis documentos/FontLab/Studio5/fontlab.fea 223]  
[WARNING] feature already defined: kern [C:/Documents and Settings/Fernando/Mis documentos/FontLab/Studio5/fontlab.fea 436]  
[WARNING] feature already defined: kern [C:/Documents and Settings/Fernando/Mis documentos/FontLab/Studio5/fontlab.fea 652]  
[WARNING] feature already defined: kern [C:/Documents and Settings/Fernando/Mis documentos/FontLab/Studio5/fontlab.fea 886]

When i test the font (on illustrator) the kerning is not like i left it on fontlab.. the kerning space grows form this "ww" to this "w w"  
anyone knows what it is, or how to repair it?

thanks

Ferch
author: ferfolio

comments.content:
Does it look right in the preview window?

ChrisL

In "quick test as open type" it doesent recongnize the kernign or ligatures...  
In the metrics window is working correctly...

but not when the font is generated :S

what shall I do?

please help

The error message looks like you have the "kern" feature defined twice. Remove all instances of the "kern" feature from the OpenType panel and try generating the font again.

A.

hehe

you were right!

i had in the Open type panel the kerning defined tree times at the "liga" window and i didn't realise  
haha

now its working perfectly!  
Thank you both!

Ferch

PS: This is my type in progress... check it out  
 [http://typophile.com/node/35021](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017063908/http:/typophile.com/node/35021 "http://typophile.com/node/35021")
